p: Studies in North America have shown that hypoxia in estuaries can lead to changes in the biological characteristics of certain fish species within those systems (e.g., Breitburg, Hondorp, Davias, & Diaz, 2009; Eby et al., 2005; Wu, 2002). For example, when some species are exposed to hypoxia, they often aggregate in better‐oxygenated environments, which can lead to inhibitory density‐dependent effects (Campbell & Rice, 2014; Eby & Crowder, 2002; Tuckey & Fabrizio, 2016). Such fish species thus provide excellent, albeit under‐used, test subjects for elucidating the degree and direction of shifts in the environmental quality of aquatic ecosystems (Izzo et al., 2016).
